reviews.review: Beautiful co op game with geat objectives, i love playing with my friends. can be slow on finding a match but it fun anyways

Pros:
Very fun to stab people as the killer
Wide variety of playable characters
Various skill level characters
High skill ceiling means there is always more to learn

Cons:
Okay to downright horrendous matchmaking
High skill ceiling means people are going to be way better than you
Can be slightly paywalled with perks on DLC characters outperforming base characters

25 hours on PC, 1500+ on console, countless more on streams/youtube vids. This game has sucked me in more than any other game ever has*. It's loads of fun, but don't be fooled there is definitely a learning curve. The community bounces between the most toxic people you've ever met calling you a cheater for using game mechanics (not strats they don't like, build in game mechanics like the Killer's powers) to some of the most wholesome people that will offer advice and good tidings.

*I find people either absolutely love the game or think it's absolutely stupid, that 50/50 is up to you.

A decent game and good time killer. Playing as both survivor and killer has it pros and cons. The game does have it ups and down, but most games do.

Has events quite a lot to help you earn extra points for skills.

Cons:
Wait times can vary to get into match.
The match making isn't very fair

I'd just like to take a moment and say the game itself is a lot of fun. It's a well made 4v1 hunt where both sides are fun and engaging, and there's plenty of different perks you can get, as well as several avenues for leveling up. The game itself is extremely fun, and if not for one glaring issue I'd be recommending the game.

Now, let's have a bit of a chat about EAC. In case you're unaware, that's the anti-cheat software they use to keep people from modifying the game and making it terrible for everyone else. And it heckin' works, I've never ever come across a cheater and I'm glad for it. However, it works TOO well. Almost every single time the game has an update (which it does often, being an online competitive multiplayer game) some file either doesn't make it's way through Steam or otherwise gets mangled up along the way, and EAC sees that and fires up a thousand red flags to immediately boot you from the game, forcing you to lose all your items you used in that match and either reinstall the game or otherwise verify your files.

This can take upwards of fifteen-twenty minutes and can redownload several gigabytes of data. Then, when you're done, it can happen to break AGAIN mid-game if you happen to run into a bug in the game that corrupts one of your files. There have been several play sessions where I've tried to play with friends and I've spent so long just downloading and re-downloading the game's files that they got tired and stopped playing without me ever actually getting to join them in a match. On top of that, if you get kicked for that repeatedly in a short span of time (which if you run into that sort of bug once, it's likelier to happen again) you end up having a several minute wait *once you load up the game* to be able to play again. So on top of waiting for your files to re-verify, you now have to wait even longer to join your friends.

I have never, ever modified my game files, and have played with friends who also have never done so, some of which have never actually played the game before. This has even happened to them, and it's really un-fun to have to explain to someone new to the game that this is just a thing that happens sometimes.

On top of this, this clearly isn't a new problem since I've seen reports online that this sort of thing has been happening for *over two years*. It's absolute trash, and the response to such things tends to be "lol don't hack, or you get banned" instead of anything actually helpful. The only fix seems to be just verify and reverify until at some point it magically works. Maybe. Just don't keep loading the game too many times in a day or you might get banned for 'hacking'. It's absolutely inexcusable at this point, and I'm sick of it.

Honestly, I have never been the type of individual to play a game of cat and mouse. . .I love simulation or build-oriented games. However, I decided to go out on a whim and buy this game after it was recommended to me by one of my followers. Truly remarkable. Beautiful. Insert all the chef kisses in the world. 

Yes, it does get a tad bit repetitive when the killers camp a hook or you get the same killer back to back. . .but it's a really fun game! 

Cons (I've decided to list these first because the list is short):
- It's mainly a lobby simulator. Seriously. If you don't time it right, the game is useless. You're sitting there until 3 other survivors popup and a killer. That is, unless, you have friends to play with. Love my friends but they don't play these types of games.
- Some killers are overpowered compared to others. For example - The Legion (I love them - they're my go to killer) - but they can go as fast as a fully upgraded Meg with the 150% speed increase. That makes her natural perk kind of useless. If there is one killer I hate - it's ghost face. He's never detectable even when you fully rank up Meg's perks. >.>

That's pretty much my only two complaints. Everything else is positive. 

Recommendations to make the game better:
- Add a single player AI system that doesn't add bloodpoints. This will still allow people to play the game/get necessary practice while waiting between those 30+ minute wait times. 
- Add more survivor/killer disadvantages. Remember - these people are human (with the exception of a few that turned into something else). They NEED weaknesses and strengths. Like, for ghost face. He's a scrawny little 5 foot 8 or 9 white kid from a prep school (if I remember correct). He definitely wouldn't be able to throw someone over his shoulder, walk about 30+ yards, lift them up, and hook them. That's why in the movie there were multiple who would help each other (kind of like the Legion aspect or the new killers brother/sister combo).
